intro: Schlimia alpina, commonly known as the alpine schlimia, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes familiar plants like parsley and carrots. The plant features small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in late summer, typically from July to August. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, often used in traditional herbal remedies. Schlimia alpina thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments.
